content: @nikomatsakis I think we'll want to close the surveys tomorrow morning -- I guess I have access -- I don't think think it needs to happen at midnight UTC or anything. Do we know if there's some separate thing, or just toggle the open state on all the surveys?
okay, I think everything I have access to is closed except for chinese
@simulacrum thanks, I was just thinking that this had to be done today
I'm not in front of my computer right now. Will close down the Chinese one after I get up tomorrow morning.
Done closing the Chinese one. We got 462 answers this year.
Japanese survey closed. We got 185 answers. And then I have prepared a sheet for translating text responses as same folder as survey.

Italian one closed, too. 52 answers. I will prepare a spreasheet with all the free-form answers translated.

Note: IIRC last year we tried (when applicable) to translate the meaning of free-form answers, rather than word-by-word. This could help grouping and parsing concepts and suggestions.
Hypothetical example: "I'd like WASM to evolve", "I feel WASM is a bit behind" can be summarized with the same "WASM still a bit behind"

By the way, I notice the following surveys still open (I assume some of them to compensate for timezone):

  • [zh-hant]
  • hindi (0 responses)
  • korean
  • pl

can they now be closed, too?
I thought they were all closed, but yes let's close them
